column1: Perhaps he did not see the lark for a long time
column2: but he would have heard him
column3: far out of sight in the endless sky
column4: thrilling and thrilling until the world seemed to have no other sound but that clear sweetness; and what a world it was to make that sound! Whistles and chirps
column6: would have grown familiar to him. And he could at last have told which brother of the great brotherhood was making the noise he heard at any moment. The wind too: he would have listened to its thousand voices as it moved in all seasons and in all moods. Perhaps a horse would stray into the thick screen about his home
column7: and would look as solemnly on Fionn as Fionn did on it. Or
column10: all a-cock with eyes and ears and nose
column12: ere he turned and bounded away with manes all over him and hoofs all under him and tails all round him.
